note: [Low Earth orbit](#dod:low_earth_orbit) is defined here by a closest approach to Earth below 2,000 kilometers; [medium Earth orbit](#dod:medium_earth_orbit) between 2,000 and 35,586 kilometers; [geostationary orbit](#dod:geostationary_orbit) between 35,586 and 35,986 kilometers; [high Earth orbit](#dod:high_earth_orbit) above 35,986 kilometers.
title: Payloads and rocket bodies in space, by orbit
subtitle: Debris from launches or collisions is not counted. Objects are subtracted from the time series after they have reentered the Earth's atmosphere.

relatedQuestions.text: Number of objects in low Earth orbit, by type
